com.getkeepsafe.android.multistateanimation

Class MultiStateAnimation

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.getkeepsafe.android.multistateanimation.MultiStateAnimation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NotifyingAnimationDrawable.OnAnimationFinishedListener

    public class MultiStateAnimation
extends Object
implements NotifyingAnimationDrawable.OnAnimationFinishedListener
    Animates a series of separate AnimationDrawables on the background of a single View. The view to animate is passed in the constructor. Animations are added with addSection, or they can be defined in a JSON resource and passed to fromJsonResource. To start an animation, call transitionNow or queueTransition.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiStateAnimation

        public MultiStateAnimation(View view)
        Create a new instance and automatically set animations as the background of the given view.
        Parameters:
        view - If not null, animations will be set as the background of this view.

      • MultiStateAnimation

        public MultiStateAnimation()
        Create an instance without giving a view to hold the animations.

        Note that due to a limitation in AnimationDrawable, you must set created animations as the image or background of a View in an onAnimationStarting listener, otherwise the animation will not advance.

        See Also:
        MultiStateAnimation.AnimationSeriesListener.onAnimationStarting()

    • Method Detail

      • fromJsonResource

        public static MultiStateAnimation fromJsonResource(Context context,
                                   View view,
                                   int resid)
                                            throws JSONException,
                                                   IOException
        Creates a new MultiStateAnimation object from a json string.

        The document must have the following structure: 

          {
      "first_section": {
          "oneshot": false,
          "frame_duration": 33,
          "frames": [
              "frame_01",
              "frame_02"
          ],

      }
      "second_section": {
          "oneshot": true,
          "frames": [
              "other_frame_01"
          ],
          "transitions_from": {
              "first_section": {
                  "frame_duration": 33,
                  "frames": [
                          "first_to_second_transition_001",
                          "first_to_second_transition_002"
                  ]
              }
              "": {
                  "frames": [
                      "nothing_to_second_001",
                      "nothing_to_second_002"
                  ]
              }
          }
      }
  }
        The key for each entry is the ID of the state.
        "oneshot"
        If false, the animation will play in a loop instead of stopping at the last frame.
        "frame_duration"
        The number of milliseconds that each frame in the "frame" list will play. It defaults to 33 (30fps) if not given.
        "frames"
        A list of string resource ID names that must correspond to a drawable resource.
        "transitions_from"
        Optional, and is a set of animations that play when transitioning to the current state from another given state. A transition will play when the ID of the current state matches the transition's key and the state is transitioning to the state in which the transition is defined.
        Parameters:
        context - The application Context.
        view - If not null, animations will be set as the background of this view.
        resid - The resource ID the the raw json document.
        Returns:
        A new MultiStateAnimation.
        Throws:
        JSONException
        IOException

      • fromJsonResource

        public static MultiStateAnimation fromJsonResource(Context context,
                                   int resid)
                                            throws JSONException,
                                                   IOException
        Create a MultiStateAnimation from a JSON resource without a connected View.
        Parameters:
        context - the Application context.
        resid - The resource ID the the raw json document.
        Returns:
        A new MultiStateAnimation instance.
        Throws:
        JSONException
        IOException

      • getSeriesAnimationFinishedListener

        public MultiStateAnimation.AnimationSeriesListener getSeriesAnimationFinishedListener()
        Returns the registered listener, if one exists.

      • setSeriesAnimationFinishedListener

        public void setSeriesAnimationFinishedListener(MultiStateAnimation.AnimationSeriesListener listener)
        Registers a listener that will be called when a running animation finishes.

        If the animation is continuous, the listener will be called every time the last frame of the animation is played.

        Parameters:
        listener - The listener to register.

      • currentSectionDuration

        public int currentSectionDuration()
        Calculates the total duration of the current animation section, including the transition if applicable.

        If the the animation is not a oneshot, the total will be for a single loop.

        Returns:
        The total animation duration, or 0 if no animation is playing.

      • getCurrentDrawable

        public AnimationDrawable getCurrentDrawable()
        Returns the currently playing animation.

        If no animation has played since this object was created or since a call to clearAnimation(), null is returned.

      • getCurrentSectionId

        public String getCurrentSectionId()
        Return the ID of the current section if one is playing, or null otherwise.

      • getTransitioningFromId

        public String getTransitioningFromId()
        If the currently playing animation is a transition, return the ID of the section that is being transitioned from.

        Return null if no animation is playing, or the currently playing animation is not a transition.

      • queueTransition

        public void queueTransition(String id)
        Queues a section to start as soon as the current animation finishes.

        If no animation is playing, the queued animation will be started immediately. Queueing a transition to the currently playing section has no effect.

        Parameters:
        id - The name of the section that will be queued.

      • transitionNow

        public void transitionNow(String id)
        Starts a specific section without waiting for the current animation to finish.

        If there is a defined transition from the current section to the new one, the transition will be played, followed immediately by the regular section animation. Transitioning to the currently playing section will restart the animation.

        Parameters:
        id - The name of the section that will be played.

      • clearAnimation

        public void clearAnimation()
        Clear any currently playing animation. This will cause a "" transition to be played before the next queued section, if one was defined for .

      • onAnimationFinished

        public void onAnimationFinished()
        Callback that is run when a playing animation finishes.
        Specified by:
        onAnimationFinished in interface NotifyingAnimationDrawable.OnAnimationFinishedListener
